segments.text: Dr. Geller, there's a seat over here.
segments.speaker: Older Scientist

segments.text: Thank you, Dr. Phillips, but I'm having my lunch at this table, here in the middle.
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: I'm having lunch right here, with my good friend Joey, if he'll sit with me.
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: I will sit with you Dr. Geller.
segments.speaker: Joey

segments.text: Y'know, we work in a museum of natural history, and yet there is something unnatural about the way we eat lunch.
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: Now, I look around this cafeteria, and y'know what I see, I see-I see division.
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: Division, between people in white coats and people in blue blazers, and I ask myself, "My God why?!"
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: Now, I say we shed these-these coats that separate us, and we get to know the people underneath.
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: I'm Ross!
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: I'm divorced, and I have a kid!
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: I'm Joey! I'm an actor! I don't know squat about dinosaurs!
segments.speaker: Joey

segments.text: I'm Ted, and I just moved here a month ago, and New York really scares me.
segments.speaker: Another Tour Guide

segments.text: All right, there you go!
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: Yeah, you hang in there Teddy!
segments.speaker: Joey

segments.text: I'm Andrew, and I didn't pay for this pear.
segments.speaker: Older Scientist

segments.text: Okay, good-good for you.
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: I'm Rhonda,  and these aren't real!
segments.speaker: Tour Guide

segments.text: Wow, Rhonda.
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: I'm Scott.
segments.speaker: Another Scientist

segments.text: Yeah, okay, Scott!
segments.speaker: Ross

segments.text: And I need to flip the light switch on and off 17 times before I leave a room or my family will die.
segments.speaker: Another Scientist
